items.title: Trump threatens Iran with 'major destruction' as US fleet arrives in Gulf
items.description: The US president says Tehran should make a deal or face military strikes as tensions between the two countries escalate.

items.title: RBA warned to 'tread carefully' or risk hitting stressed borrowers for six
items.description: The Reserve Bank cut interest rates three times last year, betting inflation would moderate. But that hasn't happened, and now a rate hike looks likely next month — and possibly another in May.

items.title: Travel agents overwhelmed by new UK passport rules
items.description: New passport rules for UK-Australian dual citizens have customers in "tears", say travel agents who are working through the night to help.

items.title: Minnesota agents put on leave as Trump says mayor is 'playing with fire'
items.description: The Trump administration is trying to manage a national uproar over Alex Pretti's killing and officials' subsequent comments about the 37-year-old nurse, who they accused of "domestic terrorism".

items.title: Grid hits major milestone as coal, gas shrink amid 'tripling' battery discharge
items.description: Amid fits and starts, Australia's energy transition turned a big corner in 2025, as renewables shot past fossil fuels despite demand records.

items.title: Sinner and Alcaraz's dominance raising uncomfortable Aus Open question
items.description: The gap between the top seeds and the rest of the players in both the men's and women's draws has resulted in another day filled with straight-sets wipeouts at the Australian Open.

items.title: Would-be tenants queried on 'lifestyle' in 50-question rental applications
items.description: Tenants are being forced to hand over excessive personal data when applying for rental properties, with new research warning that applicants' personal information could be at risk.

items.title: Live: Wall Street drifts as Fed leaves rates on hold, ASX poised for flat opening
items.description: The US Fed's decision to hold interest rates has kept a lid on Wall Street trading and the ASX is set to follow suit with an expected flat opening. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: MP battling cancer says condemned health agency could have saved him
items.description: Victorian Greens MP Tim Read reveals he will retire from politics at this year's election after he was diagnosed with metastatic cancer — but not before one last political fight.

items.title: Live: Littleproud pushes back on reports he 'rebuffed' meeting with Ley
items.description: Nationals leader David Littleproud has pushed back on reports he "rebuffed" a meeting with Sussan Ley to mend the friendship. Follow live.

items.title: Otways fire eases as Victoria's north swelters amid heatwave
items.description: Firefighting conditions have improved around the fire that burnt through properties near the town of Gellibrand in Victoria's south-west, but crews warn the blaze is still not under control.

items.title: What the US TikTok deal means for Australia's 'digital sovereignty'
items.description: US politicians — both Republican and Democrat — had worried TikTok's Chinese ownership could mean American user data was vulnerable.

items.title: Perth Invasion Day bomb incident being investigated as 'potential terrorist act'
items.description: A joint statement by WA Police, the Australian Federal Police and domestic security agency ASIO say the agencies' investigations are ongoing.

items.title: Telstra warns older iPhones may be unable to connect to Triple Zero
items.description: Customers are advised to delay software updates on affected devices and find alternative ways to communicate if needed.

items.title: Jetstar twice violated own policy on fees for changing support worker's name
items.description: The 22-year-old northern Tasmanian man with a disability was incorrectly told he'd have to pay a fee to change the name of his support worker on a ticket. After an apology and a refund, it happened again.

items.title: Police to detail discovery of remains in private Celine Cremer search
items.description: A press conference is scheduled to be held in Tasmania today, following the shock discovery of human bones in the remote area where a Belgian backpacker went missing more than two years ago.

items.title: These are the sticking points as phase two of the Gaza ceasefire arrives
items.description: The body of the final Israeli hostage has been returned, but uncertainty remains about the future of the strip, including who will oversee its administration, whether Hamas will disarm and the withdrawal of Israeli assets.

items.title: Masters winner the latest to abandon LIV Golf for PGA Tour return
items.description: Patrick Reed, the 2018 Masters champion, announces he is leaving LIV Golf for a return to the PGA Tour.

items.title: Quiz: How well did you survive six weeks with the kids at home?
items.description: We made it. The kids are returning to school. See how much you learned during the most recent, interminable school holiday period with our quiz.

items.title: Parents left in the dark over missing childcare documents
items.description: An ABC investigation has found some parent complaints and incident reports were excluded from a major release of ACT childcare documents, raising concerns about the scale and severity of problems in the sector.

items.title: Rotary club folds after 72 years as the way people volunteer changes
items.description: As traditional volunteer clubs struggle to survive, small towns and national bodies rethink how Australians give their time.

items.title: Deputy principal stood down over de facto relationship, bullying inquiry told
items.description: A former deputy principal at a Tasmanian Catholic School has told a parliamentary inquiry he was "treated as though morally compromised" and stood down after revealing he was in a de facto relationship.

items.title: Chinese authorities to visit Brisbane as baby attack investigation continues
items.description: China's ambassador to Australia says authorities will travel to Brisbane as the search for the man who threw hot coffee on a baby continues.

items.title: Gem hunter illegally mined tonnes of turquoise ore at NT sacred site
items.description: A gemstone dealer has received a four-month suspended prison sentence for illegally mining more than 8 tonnes of turquoise ore at a Northern Territory sacred site.

items.title: Rising bike thefts inconveniencing the nation but police say it's 'opportunistic'
items.description: If it hasn't happened to you, you likely know several people who have had their bikes stolen, and it isn't just those that are worth a lot of money.
